subject: RE: [junit] Re: How to test private methods in a class.
msgSnippet: It looks like nobody who s involved in the discussion likes your suggestion, David.  However, I do, for what it s worth. Todd.
messageBody:
It looks like nobody who's involved in the discussion
likes your suggestion, David. However, I do, for what
it's worth.


Todd.

> -----Original Message-----
> From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On
> Behalf Of David Saff
> Sent: Wednesday, September 07, 2005 4:13 AM
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: Re: [junit] Re: How to test private methods in a class.
>
> May I make a meta-suggestion?
>
> I think the trenches have been pretty firmly dug on this
> thread, and little more can be done to shed actual light on
> either side's position.
> How about a three-day truce (until 10 September) in which no
> one posts about this topic. After that, anyone is welcome to
> restart the discussion.
>
> David Saff
